intro: Melodorum topazense, commonly known as the Topaz Trumpet, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are sturdy and branched. Melodorum topazense thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
